tit.j: 丹後天橋立大江山国定公園
tit.cmt: 一部大文字にしました。

sen.j: 丹後天橋立大江山国定公園（たんごあまのはしだておおえやまこくていこうえん）は、京都府京丹後市から京都府舞鶴市の由良川河口右岸に至る「丹後半島海岸地区」及び、丹後半島内陸部の「世屋高原地区」、福知山市の旧大江町地域を中心とした「大江山連峰地区」の3地区で構成された国定公園。
sen.e: The Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama quasi-national park consists of the three areas of "the seashore area of the Tango peninsula," which covers the area from Kyotango City of Kyoto Prefecture to the right-side shore of the estuary of Yura-gawa River in Maizuru City, of "the Seya highland area," an inland area of the Tango peninsula, and of "the Oe-yama mountain range area" centered on the Oe-cho area of Fukuchiyama City.

The Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama quasi-national park consists of the three areas of "the seashore area of the Tango peninsula," which covers the area from Kyotango City of Kyoto Prefecture to the right-side shore of the estuary of Yura-gawa River in Maizuru City, of "the Seya highland area," an inland area of the Tango peninsula, and of "the Oe-yama mountain range area" centered on the Oe-cho area of Fukuchiyama City.

The Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park consists of the three areas of 'the seashore area of the Tango peninsula,' which covers the area from Kyotango City of Kyoto Prefecture to the right-side shore of the estuary of Yura-gawa River in Maizuru City, of 'the Seya highland area,' an inland area of the Tango peninsula, and of 'the Oe-yama mountain range area' centered on the former Oe-cho area of Fukuchiyama City.
sen.cmt: Quasi-National としました。" → ' としました。

sen.j: 2007年8月3日に若狭湾国定公園から丹後半島海岸地区を独立させ、他の2地区を追加指定する形で新設された。
sen.e: On August 3, 2007, this park was newly established by separating the seashore area of the Tango peninsula from the Wakasa bay quas-national park and by additionally designating the other two areas described above.

On August 3, 2007, this park was newly established by separating the seashore area of the Tango peninsula from the Wakasa bay quas-national park and by additionally designating the other two areas described above.

On August 3, 2007, this park was newly established by separating the seashore area of the Tango peninsula from the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park and by additionally designating the other two areas described above.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 56番目に指定された、現在日本で最も新しい国定公園である。
sen.e: The quasi-antional park is the 56th and newest one in Japan.
The quasi-antional park is the 56th and newest one in Japan.
It is designated as the fifty-sixth quasi-national park, and the newest one in Japan.

sen.j: 総面積は約19,023ヘクタールで、うち3,762ヘクタールは若狭湾国定公園から分離した部分である。
sen.e: The total land space is approx. 19,023 ha, of which 3,762 ha is the area that has been separated from the Wakasa bay quas-national park
The total land space is approx. 19,023 ha, of which 3,762 ha have been separated from the Wakasa bay quas-national park
The total land space is approx. 19,023 ha, of which 3,762 ha have been separated from the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 日本海に面した丹後半島沿岸では、日本三景のひとつ天橋立や、伊根の舟屋群、鳴き砂で知られる琴引浜などがある。
sen.e: Along the seashore of the Tango peninsular facing Japan Sea, this park includes Amanohashidate, one of the three most beautiful viewing sites in Japan, Funaya-gun (boat houses) in Ine and Kotohiki-hama Beach famous for naki-suna (the sand that makes sound when treaded on it).

Along the seashore of the Tango peninsular facing Japan Sea, this park includes Amanohashidate, one of the three most beautiful viewing sites in Japan, Funaya-gun (boat houses) in Ine and Kotohiki-hama Beach famous for naki-suna (the sand that makes sound when treaded on it).

Along the seashore of the Tango peninsular facing Japan Sea, this park includes Amanohashidate, one of the three most beautiful viewing sites in Japan, Funaya-gun (boat houses) in Ine and Kotohiki-hama Beach famous for naki-suna (the sand that makes sound when treaded on it).

sen.j: 内陸部の世屋高原には近畿有数のブナ林が広がり、大江山は鬼伝説で知られる。
sen.e: In the inland Seya highland area, one of the largest Japanese beech forests in the Kinki region spreads, and Oe-yama Mountain is famous for legends about ogres.
The inland Seya highland area contains one of the largest Japanese beech forests in the Kinki region while Oe-yama Mountain is famous for legends about ogres.
The inland Seya highland area contains one of the largest Japanese beech forests in the Kinki region while Mt. Oe is famous for legends about ogres.
History
History
History

sen.j: 2007年8月3日 若狭湾国定公園から分離した部分に、新たな地域を加えた上で新設。
sen.e: On August 3, 2007, this park was newly established by separating part of the Wakasa bay quas-national park and by additing new areas to the separated one.
On August 3, 2007, this park was newly established by separating part of the Wakasa bay quas-national park and by additing new areas to the separated one.
August 3, 2007: This park was newly established by separating part of the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park and by adding new areas to the separated one.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。
